      • createNameEndingFilter

        public static java.io.FileFilter createNameEndingFilter(java.lang.String... endings)
        Creates a FileFilter for Files, which only accepts files with given endings.

        Exemplary use:
         File folder = new File(myFolderName);
 for (File file : folder.listFiles(createNameEndingFilter(".zip", ".7z"));
        unpackFile(file);
        Parameters:
        endings -
        Returns:

      • getFileContent

        public static java.lang.String getFileContent(java.io.File f)
                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Reads all file content from file (make sure to check access rights and do not expose to outside without care).
        Parameters:
        f - the file to read from
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - in case something goes wrong

      • writeContentToFile

                               throws java.io.IOException
        Writes content to the specified file. Overrides existing content.
        Parameters:

        filename -
        Throws:

      • makeValidFilename

        public static java.lang.String makeValidFilename(java.lang.String string)
        Parameters:
        string - string to be converted to a valid filename
        Returns:
        a filename that should be a valid filename on "normal" filesystems under windows and linux (without considering filename length limitations). If this is called with two different strings, two different output strings are returned (so the mapping is injective). It is even possible to compute the original string from the filename by applying StringUtil.urlDecode(String).

      • getResourceAsStream

        public static java.io.InputStream getResourceAsStream(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                      java.lang.String fileName)
                                               throws java.io.IOException
        Get test resource as InputStream. If the resource is not found, an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        clazz - class to resolve the resource path against
        fileName - name of resource to open
        Returns:
        the resource stream; resources are located relative to the provided class
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when resource is not found or on IO errors

      • readResourceAsString

        public static java.lang.String readResourceAsString(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                    java.lang.String fileName)
                                             throws java.io.IOException
        Get test resource as String. If the resource is not found, an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        clazz - class to resolve the resource path against
        fileName - name of resource to open
        Returns:
        the contents of the resource; resources are located relative to the provided class
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when resource is not found or on IO errors
